item.title: ABOUT
item.description: Experience 2023-**** Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science, Sapienza University of Rome 2022-2023 Research Fellow INFN, Istituto Nazionale di Fisica Nucleare CINI, Consorzio Interuniversitario Nazionale per l’Informatica 2022-2023 Teaching Assistant LUISS, Department of Business and Management 2017-2018 Research Intern Alcor lab, Sapienza University of Rome Education 2019-2022 PhD Information and Communication Technologies Sapienza University of Rome / UiT The Arctic University of Norway 2017-2019 MSc Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Sapienza University of Rome 2014-2017 BSc Computer and System Engineering Sapienza University of Rome CV Here!

item.title: ACTIVITIES
item.description: Talks LoG MeetUp Trento Explainable Graph Neural Networks Università della Svizzera Italiana Fair Graph Representation Learning Roma Tre University Graph Machine Learning Workshop organization This year we are organizing the second edition of the Beyond Euclidean: Hyperbolic & Hyperspherical Learning for Computer Vision, in conjunction with ICCV Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV) 2025. I’ve organized the Beyond Euclidean: Hyperbolic & Hyperspherical Learning for Computer Vision, held in conjunction with European Conference on Computer Vision (ECCV) 2024.

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: Links to other websites Other websites referenced here may collect information about you, use cookies, embed additional tracking services from third parties, and record your interaction with that embedded content, including your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are signed in to that website.

item.title: TEACHING
item.description: a.y. 2025/2026 Fundamentals of Data Science / Foundation of Data Science M.Sc. in Data Science, Sapienza University of Rome. a.y. 2024/2025 Fundamentals of Data Science and Laboratory M.Sc. in Data Science, Sapienza University of Rome.Course Site and material a.y. 2023/2024 Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Unit 1 B.Sc. in Applied Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence, Sapienza University of Rome. Course Material Thesis We are pursuing several projects in the following research areas: Generative Models in Robotics, Explainable Reinforcment Learning, Machine Unlearning, Human Motion Generation.
